tgt_text: afrika tshipembe ḽo vha ḽi sa athu vhuya ḽa ṱangana na tshiimo tsha shishi tsha mutakalo wa lushaka nga nḓila hei.

src_text: we had to act quickly to save lives.
tgt_text: ro mbo tea u shuma nga u ṱavhanya u itela u tshidza matshilo.

src_text: and we must acknowledge that in the days and weeks that have followed, the provision of support to our country’s most vulnerable citizens has been slower than required, and that lapses have occurred.
tgt_text: ri tea u zwi ṱanganedza zwauri kha maḓuvha na vhege dzo tevhelaho, ṋetshedzo ya thikhedzo kha vhadzulapo vha shango ḽashu vha sa koni u ḓi tsireledza yo vha i khou ongolowa i si nga nḓila ine ya khou ṱoḓiswa zwone, na zwauri vhukhakhi ho itea.

src_text: however, the payment of social grants has proceeded relatively smoothly, and after a number of technical challenges, the food distribution system is being streamlined.
tgt_text: naho zwo ralo, mbadelo ya mindende yo tshimbila zwavhuḓi, nahone nga murahu ha khaedu dza zwa thekhiniki dza tshivhalo, sisṱeme ya khovhekanyo ya zwiḽiwa i khou dzudzanywa.

src_text: imposing a nationwide lockdown at very short notice presented several challenges.
tgt_text: khombetshedzo ya nyiledzo dza u tshimbila kha shango ḽoṱhe kha nḓivhadzo yo itwaho nga tshifhinga tshiṱuku zwo bveledza khaedu nnzhi.

src_text: we have had to weigh up the proportionality of the national response and the extent of restrictions we would need to impose.
tgt_text: ro mbo tea u ela ndivhanele ya phindulo ya lushaka na vhuhulu ha nyiledzo dzine ra tea u dzi ita.

src_text: we ultimately chose to err on the side of caution.
tgt_text: ro fhedzisela ro nanga u wela kha sia ḽine ḽa ri vhea fhethu havhuḓi.

src_text: and as the presentation by the ministry of health indicated recently, enforcing a lockdown at the time we did has slowed down the rate of infection and, more importantly, bought us time to prepare for a probable surge in infections in the coming weeks and months.
tgt_text: sa zwe ḽikumedzwa nga vha muhasho wa mutakalo ḽa sumbedza zwenezwino, u kombetshedza nyiledzo dza u tshimbila nga tshifhinga tshe ra ita ngatsho zwo fhungudza phimo ya phirela nahone zwa ndemesa, zwo ri fha tshifhinga tsha u dzudzanya u gonya ha phirela kha dzivhege na miṅwedzi i ḓaho.

src_text: we had to consider the impact on an already floundering economy in both the long and short term, and the impact of this substantial disruption on the livelihoods of millions of people.
tgt_text: ro tea u sedza u kwamea ha ikonomi yo no vhaisalaho kha tshifhinga tshipfufhi na tshilapfu, nahone u kwamea ha tshinyadzo khulu iyi kha matshilo a dzimiḽioni dza vhathu.

src_text: we had to consider what weeks of confinement to the home would mean for the employed not paid regular salaries, for the unemployed and those seeking work, for those in casual or seasonal employment, for those in the informal sector, for the indigent and for the vulnerable.
tgt_text: ri tea u sedza uri vhege dza u valelwa mahayani zwi amba mini kha vhashumi vha sa nga holelwi miholo yavho ya nga misi, kha vha sa shumi na avho vhane vha khou ṱoḍa mushumo, kha avho vhashumi vha tshifhinganyana kana vha tshifhingatetshelwa, kha avho vha re kha sekithara zwadzo, kha vhashayi na vha sa koni u ḓi tsireledza.

src_text: cabinet will finalise a set of measures to respond to the impact of the lockdown on the livelihoods of our people.
tgt_text: khabinethe i ḓo khunyeledza mutevhe wa maga u fhindula mveledzo dza nyiledzo dza u tshimbila kha matshilo a vhathu vhashu.

src_text: this has been preceded by a range of engagements with a number of stakeholders including business, labour, religious organisations, civil society and the presidential economic advisory council.
tgt_text: hezwi zwo rangelwa nga tshivhalo tsha nyanḓano na tshivhalo tsha vhafaramikovhe zwi tshi katela vhubindudzi, vhashumi, madzangano a vhurereli, vhadzulapo na khoro ya ngeletshedzo ya ikonomi ya zwa phresidennde.

src_text: the social partners have put forward a number of proposals on interventions that could address the immediate vulnerability of the poorest of the poor, most of whom rely on social assistance to survive.
tgt_text: vhashumisani vha zwa matshilisano vho vhea phanḓa tshivhalo tsha makumedzwa a a vhuḓidzhenisi vhune ha nga fhindula khanganeo ine ya vha hone na zwezwo ya vhashayi vha vhashayi, vhunzhi havho vha ḓitika nga thusedzo ya zwa matshilisano.

src_text: we will scale up welfare provision during this period to help households living below the poverty line.
tgt_text: ri ḓo gonyisa ṋetshedzo ya vhulondoti nga tshifhinga hetshi u thusa miṱa i tshilaho kha vhushayi vhukuma.

src_text: even when the nationwide lockdown is lifted, its effects will continue to be felt for some time to come.
tgt_text: naho zwa nyiledzo dza u tshimbila kha shango ḽoṱhe zwa fheliswa, mveledzo yayo i ḓo dzulela u tshenzhelwa lwa tshifhinga.

src_text: those fortunate to have a steady income will be able to return to their jobs; but for millions of others this will be a lost month where they would otherwise have found temporary work, done business in the informal sector or saved money earned to meet their family responsibilities.
tgt_text: avho vha re na mashudu a u vha na miholo yo khwaṱhaho vha ḓo kona u humela mishumoni yavho; fhedzi kha vhunzhi ha vhaṅwe uyu u ḓo vha ṅwedzi wo lozweaho une vho vha vha tshi ḓo vha vho wana mushu mo wa tshifhinganyana, vho ita vhubindudzi kha sekithara dzazwo kana vho vhulunga masheleni e vha hola u swikela vhuḓifhinduleli ha miṱani yavho.

src_text: food support is a shortterm emergency measure.
tgt_text: thikhedzo ya zwiḽiwa ndi maga a shishi a tshifhinga tshipfufhi.

src_text: it will need to be matched by sustainable solutions that help our most vulnerable citizens weather the difficult times that are still to come.
tgt_text: zwi ḓo tea u ṱanganyiswa na thandululo dzo khwaṱhaho dzine dza ḓo thusa vhadzulapo vhashu vha sa koni u ḓi tsireledza kha zwifhinga zwi konḓaho zwine zwa nga kha ḓi ḓa.

src_text: i wish to thank the many ngos, religious groups and ordinary citizens who are donating money and volunteer ing to help feed the hungry and destitute.
tgt_text: ndi tama u livhuwa vhunzhi ha dzingo, zwigwada zwa vhurereli na vhadzulapo zwavho vhane vha khou ṋetshedza masheleni na u shuma vha sa nga wani malamba kha u thusa vha tshi fusha avho vha re na nḓala na vhashayi.

src_text: alleviating hunger is not an act of charity.
tgt_text: u fhelisa nḓala a si nyito ya vhuthu.

src_text: it is an imperative for any society that is founded on respect for human rights.
tgt_text: ndi ndaela ya tshitshavha tshiṅwe na tshiṅwe tsho thomiwaho nga ṱhonifho ya pfanelo dza vhathu.

src_text: we are at a point in our battle with the pandemic where complacency could prove disastrous.
tgt_text: ri vhukati na nndwa yashu ya u lwisana na dwadze hune u ḓigeḓa zwi nga itisa mutshinyalo.

src_text: i call on each and every one to remain vigilant, to continue to abide by the regulations, and to keep safe and keep others safe.
tgt_text: ndi ita khuwelelo kha roṱhe uri ri dzule ro rafhuwa, u isa phanḓa vha tshi tevhedza milayo, vha dzule vho tsireledzea nahone vha tsireledze na vhaṅwe.

src_text: as government we will be providing information on the direct interventions we are taking to shield our most vulnerable citizens from the grim prospect of starvation.
tgt_text: sa muvhuso ri ḓo ṋetshedza mafhungo thwii nga nḓila ya u dzhenelela ine ra khou i dzhia kha u tsireledza vhadzulapo vhashu vha sa koni u ḓi tsireledza kha mathada ane a nga vha vhulaisa nga nḓala.

src_text: among the many difficulties our people face at this time, wondering where their next meal will come from should not be one of them.
tgt_text: thusedzo ya vhadzulapo vhashu vha sa koni u ḓi tsireledza vukuzenzele unnamed mashango manzhi u mona na ḽifhasi a kha nyiledzo dza u tshimbila nga ṅwambo wa khoronavairasi a tshi khou itela u tshidza matshilo a vhathu vhao.

src_text: let us unite in our fight against covid19 vukuzenzele unnamed the entire world is in the unrelenting grip of the coronavirus pandemic, whose spread has been rapid.
tgt_text: kha ri farisane kha nndwa kha ri farisane kha nndwa yashu ya u lwa na yashu ya u lwa na covid19 vukuzenzele unnamed covid19ḽḽifhasi ḽothe nga vhuphara ḽo fara tshi konḓaho nga dwadze ḽa tshitzhili tsha corona, ḽine ḽa khou phaḓalala nga luvhilo.

src_text: a vaccine has yet to be found.
tgt_text: khaelo a i athu u wanala.

src_text: across the world, over 3.4 million people are known to be infected and more than 240,000 have died.
tgt_text: u mona na ḽifhasi, vhathu vha tshivhalo tshi fhiraho 3.4 miḽioni vho kavhiwa na uri ho no lovha vha fhiraho 240,000. ngangoho hezwi ndi zwifhinga zwi lemelaho.

src_text: these are indeed desperate times.
tgt_text: musi hu tshi tiwa mulevho wa tshiimo tsha tshiwo tsha lushaka vhegeni dza rathi dzo fhiraho, afrika tshipembe ḽo vha ḽi na zwiwo zwo khwaṱhisedzwaho zwa u kavhiwa nga tshitzhili tsha corona zwa 61. naho tshivhalo itshi tshi fhasi, kuvhonele kwa vhaḓivhi na tshenzhemo ya dzitshakatshaka zwo sumbedzisa uri u kavhiwa hu nga gonya nga nḓila khulwane nahone nga luvhilo.

src_text: when the national state of disaster was declared six weeks ago, south africa only had 61 confirmed coronavirus infections.
tgt_text: ndo amba uri hu tea u dzhiiwa maga a ndeme nahone nga u ṱavhanya.

src_text: despite the relatively low number, expert opinion and international experience indicated that infec tions would rise exponentially.
tgt_text: maga ayo – ane a katela nyiledza u bva mahayani ya lushaka lwoṱhe na u valwa ha mikano yashu – o sumbedza u shuma kha u lengisa u phaḓalala ha vhulwadze.

src_text: i said that urgent and drastic measures would need to be taken.
tgt_text: hezwi zwo konadzea ngauri vhunzhi ha maafrika tshipembe vho tevhedzela mbetshelwa dza nyiledza u bva mahayani, u ita maitele a u sa vha tsinitsini na vhaṅwe na u ambara masiki wa khofheni.

src_text: those measures – which included a nationwide lockdown and the closure of our borders – have proved to be effective in delaying the spread of the disease.
tgt_text: ndi a vha rwelwa zwanḓa kha hezwi na huṅwe u ḓidzima he vha ita.

src_text: this has been possible because most south africans have adhered to the lockdown provisions, practising social distancing and wearing face masks.
tgt_text: kha luṱa ulu lwa musi ri tshe kati na dwadze, maṅwe mashango a na zwivhalo zwinzhi zwa u kavhiwa u fhira zwine ra vha nazwo.

src_text: i applaud you for this and for all the other sacrifices you have made.
tgt_text: hune ra vha hone zwino – hune ra vha na maḓuvha a 46 u bva tshe ra rekhoda tshiwo tsha vhu100 tsha tshitzhili tsha corona – ri na zwiwo zwo khwaṱhisedzwaho zwa 6,783. italy, ḽine tshivhalo tshaḽo tsha vhathu tsha fana na tshashu, ḽo no vha na zwiwo zwi fhiraho 140,000 ngeno united states ḽi na zwiwo zwi swikaho hanefha kha 700,000 hu tshi khou vhalwa kha ḓuvha ḽa vhu46.

src_text: at this stage in the progress of the pandemic, other countries had far more infections than we do.
tgt_text: fhedzi izwi a zwi ambi uri phanzi yo pfuka.

src_text: as of now – which is 46 days since we recorded our 100th coronavirus case – we have 6,783 confirmed cases.
tgt_text: afrika tshipembe a ḽi athu tou swika maṱhakheni a u kavhiwa.

src_text: italy, which has a similar size population to ours, had more than 140,000 cases and the united states had around 700,000 confirmed cases at the 46day mark.
tgt_text: modeḽe yoṱhe ya sainthifiki i sumbedza uri phimo ya u kavhiwa i ḓo isa phanḓa na u engedzea nga luvhilo kha miṅwedzi i si gathi i ḓaho.

src_text: but this does not mean that the danger has passed.
tgt_text: fhedziha, luvhilo lune vhulwadze ha phaḓalala ngalwo na tshivhalo tsha vhathu vhane vho kavhiwa zwi ḓo bva nga zwine ra khou ita zwazwino.

src_text: we have not nearly reached the peak of infections in south africa.
tgt_text: ndi ngazwo hune u leludzwa ha nyiledza u bva mahayani hu tshi ṱoḓa u itwa nga zwiṱuku na nga u ṱhogomela.

src_text: all the scientific models show that the infection rate will continue to rise at a much faster rate in the next few months.
tgt_text: ndi nga nṱhani ha zwenezwi hune vhunzhi ha ndaulo dzi tea u dzula dzo ralo na uri ndi zwa ndeme uri vhathu vha dzi tevhedzele.

src_text: however, the speed with which the virus spreads and the number of people who are ultimately infected will be determined by what we do now.
tgt_text: ndi a zwi ḓivha uri izwi zwi lemela hani na uri ndi a pfesesa mbilaelo dzine vhunzhi ha vhafunashango vha vha nadzo nga ha nḓila ine ndaulo idzi dza khou dzhenelela ngaho na u shaedza kha pfanelo dzavho.

src_text: that is why the easing of the lockdown needs to be gradual and cautious.
tgt_text: fhedzi hezwi zwoṱhe ndi zwa ndeme.

src_text: it is for this reason that many regulations need to remain in place and why it is absolutely essential that people observe them.
tgt_text: ndivho yashu khulwane ndi u vhulunga vhutshilo.

src_text: i know how difficult this is and i understand the concern that many of our compatriots have about how these regulations are interfering and limiting their rights.
tgt_text: u sa vha tsinitsini na vhaṅwe na tsiravhulwadze yo teaho zwi kha ḓi vha vhupileli hashu ha nṱhesa kha nndwa iyi.

src_text: but all this is necessary.
tgt_text: hezwi ndi zwone zwine zwa vhigela ndaulo dze ra dzi vhekanyela u dzi shumisa kha ḽevele 4 ya vhufhinduli hashu.

src_text: our overriding objective is the preservation of life.
tgt_text: vhusedzi hashu ho ḓisendeka nga vhuṱanzi ho khwaṱhisedzwaho, data ya sainthifiki na ya zwa ikonomi khathihi na maitele a nṱhesa a dzitshakatshaka.

src_text: social distancing and proper hygiene are still our best and only defences in this struggle.
tgt_text: kha khaṱhulo ya 1995 ya khothe ya ndayotewa ye i sa ṱanganedze ndaṱiso ya zwa masheleni, vho justice arthur chaskalson vho ṅwala uri: "pfanelo dza vhutshilo na tshirunzi ndi zwa ndemesa kha pfanelo dzoṱhe dza vhathu na tshiko tsha dziṅwe pfanelo dza muthu.

src_text: this is what informs the regulations we have put in place for level 4 of our response.
tgt_text: nga u ḓikumedzela riṋe vhaṋe kha tshitshavha tsho simiwaho kha u dzhiela nzhele pfanelo dza vhathu ri tea u dzhiela nṱha idzi pfanelo mbili u fhirisa dziṅwe dzoṱhe.

src_text: our considerations are based on empirical evidence, scientific and economic data and international best practice.
tgt_text: "ndaulo dzine ra khou dzi shumisa dzo tewa kha vhuḓikumedzeli ha vhutshilo na tshirunzi, zwine zwa khwaṱhisedza vhungoho – kha nyimele idzi dzo kalulaho – nyiledzo dza tshifhinga nyana kha dziṅwe pfanelo, sa u vhofholowa kha u ya hune wa funa na u ṱangana na vhaṅwe.

src_text: in the 1995 judgment of the constitutional court that outlawed capital punishment, jus tice arthur chaskalson wrote: "the rights to life and dignity are the most important of all human rights and the source of all other personal rights.
tgt_text: nga u ita izwi, afrika tshipembe a ḽo ngo fhambana na maṅwe mashango.

src_text: by committing ourselves to a society founded on the recognition of human rights we are required to value these two rights above all others.
tgt_text: nyanganyelo ya thihi tsha ṱhanu ya tshivhalo tsha vhathu kha ḽifhasi vho khethelwa na u valelwa thungo kana vha kha nyiledza u bva mahayani ya lushaka, ngeno tshivhalo itshi tshi tshi khou engedzea nga u ṱavhanya zwi tshi fhindula u gonya ha u kavhiwa.

src_text: "the regulations we have put in place are founded on that commitment to life and dignity, and which justify – in these extreme circumstances – temporary restrictions on other rights, like freedom of movement and association.
tgt_text: izwi zwi katela mashango ane a vha na vhathu vhanzhi u fhira vhashu, sa india i na vhathu vha linganaho 1.5 biḽioni.

src_text: in doing this, south africa is not unlike many other countries.
tgt_text: mashango manzhi a khou shumisa ndaulo dzi ṱoḓaho vhathu vha tshi vha vhe mahayani nga zwifhinga zwo tiwaho sa zwine ra khou shumisa fhano.

src_text: an estimated onefifth of the world’s population is under quarantine or nationwide lockdown, with this number growing rapidly in response to rising infections.
tgt_text: u kaliwa ha mitshimbili hu khou shumiswa kha mashango o fhambanaho.

src_text: this includes countries with substantially larger populations than ours, like india with its 1.5 billion people.
tgt_text: kha ḓorobo ya uk na france , paris , u ya fhethu ha nnyi na nnyi zwo kaliwa lwa awara nkene nahone kha tshikhala tshikene u bva hune wa dzula hone.

src_text: dozens of countries have imposed curfews such as the one that is now in place here.
tgt_text: maga a pfareledzo na a thivhelo a fanaho na ashu a khou shumiswa kha mashango o fhambanaho.

src_text: limitations on movement are in place in a number of countries.
tgt_text: tsumbo, u rengiswa ha zwikambi nga tshifhinga tsha nyiledza u bva mahayani ho iledzwa kana hu a haniwa fhethu ho fhambanaho na nga mivhuso yapo, hu tshi katelwa zwipiḓa zwa mexico , hong kong na greenland , he ṅwedzi wo fhiraho ho bviswa nyiledzo ya thengiso ya zwikambi nga tshifhinga tsha nyiledza u bva mahayani u itela u fhungudza u kavhiwa khathihi na u ‘itela u langa khakhathi dza u tambudzwa ha vhana na vhafumakadzi.’hu na zwinzhi zwe tshitshavha tsha ṱahisa kha tsheo dza muvhuso dza u engedzwa ha thivhelo ya zwibveledzwa zwa mafola kha ḽeveḽe ya vhuṋa.

src_text: in the uk and the french capital, paris, public exercise is limited to certain hours and within a certain distance of one’s home.
tgt_text: tsheo i ngaho iyi i tou tea u sa ḓisa nyanḓano kha tshitshavha, fhedzi zwo khakhea u humbulela uri dziminisṱa kana phuresidennde vha khou ita kana u amba nga u funa kha fhungo iḽi.

src_text: containment and prevention measures similar to ours are in place in a number of countries.
tgt_text: nga ḽa 23 lambamai, ndo ḓivhadza uri u rengiswa ha sigareṱe zwi nga tendelwa kha ḽeveḽe ya vhuṋa.

src_text: for example, alcohol sales during lockdown have been either restricted or banned in a number of territories and by local governments, including parts of mexico, hong kong and greenland, which last month imposed a ban on alcohol sales during lockdown to limit infection but also ‘to curb violence against women and children.’there has been much public comment on government’s decision to extend the prohibition on the sale of tobacco products into level 4. a decision like this is bound to be controversial, but it is wrong to suggest that there are ministers or a president doing and saying whatever they want on this matter.
tgt_text: hezwi zwo vha zwo ḓisendeka kha muhumbulo wa khoro ya vhulaeli ya lushaka ya tshitzhili tsha corona (nccc), na uri zwo vha zwi hone kha muhanga wa mvetomveto wo iswaho tshitshavhani u itela nyambedzano.

src_text: on 23 april, i announced that cigarette sales would be permitted during level 4. this was based on the view of the national coronavirus command council (nccc), and which was contained in the draft framework that was published for consulation.
tgt_text: nga murahu ha ndavheleso na therisano dzo sedzwaho zwavhuḓi, nccc yo shandukisa kuhumbulele kwayo nga ha mafola.

src_text: after careful consideration and discussion, the nccc reconsidered its position on tobacco.
tgt_text: nga ṅwambo wa izwo, ndaulo dzo tendelwaho nga khabinethe na u ḓivhadzwa nga minisiṱa vho nkosazana dlaminizuma nga ḽa 29 lambamai dza engedza u thivhelwa uho.

src_text: as a result, the regulations ratified by cabinet and announced by minister nkosazana dlaminizuma on 29 april extended the prohibition.
tgt_text: hei ndi tsheo guṱe na uri zwiṱatamennde zwo iswaho tshitshavhani nga nṋe na minisiṱa ro vha ro imela, na u ṋewa maanḓa nga guṱe ḽa vhane nda vha ranga phanḓa.

src_text: this was a collective decision and the public statements by both myself and the minister were done on behalf of, and mandated by, the collective i lead.
tgt_text: ndaulo dzoṱhe dzine ra khou dzi shumisa dzo lavheleswa nga vhuronwane.

src_text: every regulation we have put in place has been carefully considered.
tgt_text: ri tshi khou ḓi ya phanḓa ho vha na vhukwamani ho itwaho na vhaḓivhi vha zwa mishonga, zwigwada zwa vhukhethi na nḓowetshumo dzo fhambanaho.

src_text: along the way there has been consultation with medical experts, various constituencies and different industries.
tgt_text: ro vha ri tshi khou dededzwa nga zwiimiswa zwa dzitshakatshaka na tshenzhemo ya maṅwe mashango.

src_text: we have been guided by international bodies and the experience of other countries.
tgt_text: ngoho ndi ya uri ri kha nyimele ine a ri na tshenzhemo yayo.

src_text: the reality is that we are sailing in unchartered waters.
tgt_text: hu kha ḓi vha na zwinzhi nga ha epidemiology (davhi ḽa saintsi ya mishonga ḽi sedzaho kha u phaḓalala na u langwa ha vhulwadze kha vhathu) ya tshitzhili zwi sa ḓivheiho.

src_text: there is still a great deal about the epidemiology of the virus that is unknown.
tgt_text: ndi khwine u khakha kha sia ḽa vhulondo ha u thivhela phanzi u fhirisa u badela zwihulu nga u kundelwa zwino u ṋea khaṱhulo ya ḽa matshelo.

src_text: it is better to err on the side of caution than to pay the devastating price of a lapse in judgment in future.
tgt_text: musi hu na mihumbulo yo fhambanaho kha dziṅwe dza tsheo dze ra dzhia – na uri kha dziṅwe nyimele hu na zwi fhambanyaho zwigwada – muvhuso u khou ḓidina vhukuma kha u shuma nga nḓila ine ya bveledza pfanelo dza vhutshilo na tshirunzi kha vhathu vhashu vhoṱhe.

src_text: while there are differing views on some of the decisions we have taken – and in some instances these have polarised opinion – government is making every effort to act in a way that advances the rights to life and dignity of all our people.
tgt_text: u thetshelesa vhathu vhashu na mbilaelo dzavho kha tshifhinga itshi zwo vha tshiṅwe tsha tshiṱaluli tshine riṋe sa muvhuso ro kona nga khatsho u langa dwadze iḽi.

src_text: listening to our people and their concerns during this period has been one of the distinguishing features of how we as government have managed this pandemic.
tgt_text: ri isa phanḓa na u thetshelesa mbilaelo dza vhathu vhashu na uri ro ḓilugisela u ita ndivhanyiso dzi linganyaho mbilaelo dza vhathu nga ha khaedu dzine vho livhana nadzo hu tshi itelwa u vhulunga matshilo.

src_text: we continue to listen to the concerns of our people and are prepared to make adjustments that balance people’s concerns about the challenges they face with the need to save lives.
tgt_text: kha tshifhinga itshi tshi lemelaho, nungo dzashu dzoṱhe dzi tea u sedza kha u vhona uri mutakalo na vhutshilo zwo vhulungea, uri nḓisedzo ya zwiḽiwa, maḓi, ndondola mutakalo, vhutsireledzi ha zwa matshilisano na thikhedzo ya tshitshavha a zwi thithiswi.

src_text: at this difficult time, our collective energies must be focused on ensuring that health and life is preserved, that the delivery of food, water, health care, social security and social support is not disrupted.
tgt_text: kha nyimele idzi dzo kalulaho, sa muvhuso, sa vhathu vhone vhaṋe na tshitshavha hu ḓo vha na zwifhinga zwine ra khakha.

src_text: under these extraordinary circumstances, as government, as individuals and as society we will at times make mistakes.
tgt_text: musi izwi zwi tshi itea, ri ḓo zwi khakhulula.

src_text: when these occur, we will correct them.
tgt_text: fhedzi ri tea u isa phanḓa, ri sa laṱi fulufhelo kana vhufhinduli hashu.

src_text: but we must carry on, losing neither our nerve nor our resolve.
tgt_text: nyimele ine ra ḓiwana ri khayo i ṱoḓa ri na ṱhuṱhuwedzo na u sa fhela mbilu.

src_text: the situation in which we find ourselves demands courage and patience.
tgt_text: kha ri farisane kha nndwa kha ri farisane kha nndwa yashu ya u lwa na yashu ya u lwa na covid19 vukuzenzele unnamed covid19ḽḽifhasi ḽothe nga vhuphara ḽo fara tshi konḓaho nga dwadze ḽa tshitzhili tsha corona, ḽine ḽa khou phaḓalala nga luvhilo.

src_text: our democracy will help us overcome covid19 vukuzenzele unnamed we often take our healthy and robust democracy for granted.
tgt_text: dimokirasi yashu i ḓo ri thusa u kunda covid 19 vukuzenzele unnamed ri dzulela u dzhiela fhasi dimokirasi yashu yo khwaṱhaho nahone yavhuḓi.

src_text: yet it is probably our greatest asset in our momentous struggle to overcome the coronavirus pandemic.
tgt_text: ngeno i tshi tou vha yone tshithu tsha ndeme kha nndwa yashu khulwane ya u kunda dwadze ḽa tshitzhili tsha corona.

src_text: we have among the most politicallyengaged citizenry in the world.
tgt_text: ri na vhadzulapo vhane vhunzhi havho vha ḓidzhenisa kha zwa poḽotiki kha ḽifhasi.

src_text: a poll in 2018 by the pew research center shows south africans are strongly inclined to take political action about issues they feel most strongly about, such as health care, education, freedom of speech and corruption.
tgt_text: khetho dza 2018 nga vha senthara ya ṱhoḓisiso ya pew dzo sumbedza uri vhathu vha afrika tshipembe vho ḓiimisela u dzhia vhukando ha zwa poḽotiki nga mafhungo ane vha pfa a a ndeme, a ngaho ndondolamutakalo, pfunzo, mbofholowo ya u amba na zwiito zwa vhuaḓa.

src_text: the poll confirms much that we already know about ourselves.
tgt_text: khetho dzo khwaṱhisedza vhunzhi ha zwine ra ḓivha nga ha riṋe vhaṋe.

src_text: we enjoy nothing more than robust engagement with our government and among ourselves on the burning issues of the day.
tgt_text: ri ḓifhelwa nga u ita nyambedzano dzo khwaṱhaho vhukuma na muvhuso washu na nga tshashu ri tshi khou sedza mafhungo a no khou ambeswa nga tshifhinga tshetsho.

src_text: we have an active civil society ever ready to safeguard our fundamental freedoms and rights.
tgt_text: ri na tshitshavha tsha vhadzulapo vha dzhiaho vhuḓifhinduleli ha u shuma vho ḓiimiselaho u tsireledza pfanelo dzashu dza mutheo na mbofholowo yashu .

src_text: one of the triumphs of our democracy is that every south african believes the constitution protects them and that the courts are a fair and impartial arbiter of their interests.
tgt_text: iṅwe ya tswikelo dza dimokirasi yashu ndi ya uri vhathu vhoṱhe vha afrika tshipembe vha tenda uri ndayotewa i a vha tsireledza na zwauri khothe dzi tou vha mulamukanyi kwao a sa dzhii sia kha madzangalelo avho.

src_text: i got thinking on these matters during a recent visit to the eastern cape to assess the province’s coronavirus state of readiness.
tgt_text: ndo ḓo humbula nga ha mafhungo haya zwenezwino musi ndo dalela kapa vhubvaḓuvha u ṱhaṱhuvha tshiimo tsha ndugelo tsha vundu kha tshitzhili tsha corona.

src_text: i was asked by a journalist whether i was concerned at the pending litigation challenging certain provisions of the disaster management act.
tgt_text: ndo vhudziswa nga ramafhungo uri ndo vhilaedzwa naa nga ha vhukando ha mulayo vhu sa athu dzhiwaho vhu no khou itela khaedu dziṅwe mbetshelwa dza mulayo wa ndangulo ya tshiwo.

src_text: this law is the basis for all the regulations promulgated under the national state of disaster we declared to combat coronavirus.
tgt_text: mulayo uyu ndi mutheo wa ndaulo dzoṱhe dzo khwaṱhisedzwaho kha tshiimo tsha tshiwo tsha lushaka we ra u ḓivhadza kha u lwa na tshitzhili tsha corona.

src_text: since the start of this crisis, a number of people have exercised their right to approach the courts.
tgt_text: u bva tshe tshiwo itshi tsha thoma, vhathu vha tshivhalo vho shumisa pfanelo dzavho u ya dzikhothe.

src_text: the lockdown regulations were challenged in the very first week of the lockdown by a private citizen from mpumalanga who wanted an exemption from the travel prohibition to attend a funeral.
tgt_text: milayo ya nyiledza u bva mahayani yo itelwa khaedu kha vhege ya u thoma ya nyiledza u bva mahayani nga mudzulapo zwawe a bvaho mpumalanga we a vha a tshi khou ṱoḓa u vhofhololwa kha thivhelo dza u tshimbila uri a ye mbulungoni.

src_text: in the seven (7) weeks that have followed, there have been legal challenges from a number of individuals, religious bodies, political parties, ngos and from business organisations against one measure or more of the lockdown provisions they were unhappy with.
tgt_text: kha vhege dza sumbe dzo tevhelaho, ho vha na khaedu dza zwa mulayo dzo bvaho kha tshivhalo tsha vhathu, vha vhurereli, madzangano a zwa poḽotiki, dzingo na kha madzangano a vhubindudzi malugana na ḽiga ḽithihi kana u fhira a mbetshelwa dza nyiledza u bva mahayani dzi sa vha takadziho.

src_text: some have succeeded in their legal challenges and some have not.
tgt_text: vhaṅwe vho kona u kunda kha khaedu dzavho dza zwa mulayo fhedzi vhaṅwe zwo vha balela.

src_text: some had approached the courts on the basis of the urgency of their cases had their urgency arguments dismissed and others have found other avenues for the relief they sought.
tgt_text: vhaṅwe vho ya khothe nga vhanga ḽa vhuṱhogwa ha milandu yavho he mbilo dzavho dza vhuṱhogwa dzenedzo dza laṱwa nga khothe ngeno vhaṅwe vho wana dziṅwe nḓila dza ndiliso dze vha vha vha tshi khou dzi ṱoḓa.

src_text: others have subsequently withdrawn their applications following engagement with government.
tgt_text: vhaṅwe vho fhedza vho humisela murahu khumbelo dzavho nga murahu ha nyambedzano na muvhuso.

src_text: while we would prefer to avoid the need for any legal action against government, we should accept that citizens who are unhappy with whatever action that government has decided on implementing have a right to approach our courts for any form of relief they seek.
tgt_text: musi ri tshi nga tama u thivhela vhukando ha mulayo vhufhio na vhufhio vhu dzhielwaho muvhuso, ri tea u zwi ṱanganedza uri vhadzulapo vha sa takadzwi nga nyito ifhio na ifhio ye muvhuso wa nanga u shumisa yone vha na pfanelo ya u ya khothe dzashu u itela thuso ifhio na ifhio ine vha i ṱoḓa.

src_text: this is a normal tenet of a constitutional democracy and a perfectly acceptable practice in a country founded on the rule of law.
tgt_text: izwi zwi tou vha maitele kwao a dimokirasi ya ndayotewa na maitele a ṱanganedzeaho avhuḓi kha shango o thomiwaho nga ndango ya mulayo.

src_text: we have checks and balances in place to ensure that every aspect of governance is able to withstand constitutional scrutiny.
tgt_text: ri na ndinganyiso dze ra vhea u khwaṱhisedza uri tshipiḓa tshiṅwe na tshiṅwe tsha vhuvhusi tshi kone u imedzana na tsedzuluso dza ndayotewa.

src_text: where we are found wanting, we will be held to account by our courts and, above all, by our citizens.
tgt_text: hune ra wanala ri tshi khou shaedza, ri ḓo tea u ṋetshedza vhuḓifhinduleli kha khothe, nahone nṱha ha zwoṱhe, kha vhadzulapo vhashu.

src_text: besides our courts, our chapter 9 institutions exist to advance the rights of citizens, as do the bodies tasked with oversight over the law enforcement agencies.
tgt_text: nga nnḓani ha khothe dzashu zwiimiswa zwashu zwa ndima ya vhuṱahe (zwiimiswa zwi tikedzaho dimokirasi) zwi hone u bveledza pfanelo dza vhadzulapo vhashu, sa zwine zwiimiswa zwo hweswaho maanḓa a vhulavhelesi nga kha mazhendedzi a vhukombetshedzi ha mulayo zwa ita.

src_text: as i told the journalist, every south african has a right to approach the courts and even i, as president, could never stand in the way of anybody exercising that right.
tgt_text: sa zwe nda vhudza ramafhungo, muthu muṅwe na muṅwe wa afrika tshipembe u na pfanelo ya u ya khothe nahone zwi ḓinga na nṋe, sa muphuresidennde, ndi nga si ime phanḓa ha muthu na muthihi ane a shumisa pfanelo iyo.

src_text: there has been, and will continue to be, robust and strident critique of a number of aspects of our national response to coronavirus, from the data modelling and projections, to the economic effects of the lockdown, to the regulations.
tgt_text: ho vha na, nahone zwi ḓo ya phanḓa u vha na tsatsaladzo yo vhifhaho nahone khulwane vhukuma ya tshivhalo tsha zwithu zwinzhi kha maitele ashu a u lwa na tshitzhili tsha corona, zwo bva kha nzudzanyo na ṋetshedzo ya data, kha mvelelo dza ikonomi dza nyiledza u bva mahayani, na kha milayo.

src_text: as government we have neither called for such critique to be tempered or for it to be silenced.
tgt_text: sa muvhuso a ro ngo ita khuwelelo ya uri tsatsaladzo dzenedzo dzi thivhelwe kana dzi fheliswe.

src_text: to the contrary, criticism, where it is constructive, helps us to adapt and to move with agility in response to changing circumstances and conditions.
tgt_text: kha ḽiṅwe sia u sasaladzwa arali zwi tshi khou fhaṱa zwi a ri thusa na uri ḓowedza uri ri ye phanda nga vhuṱali nga u ṱavhanya ri tshi khou ḓisa phindulo ya nyimele dza tshanduko.

src_text: it enriches public debate and gives us all a broader understanding of the issues at play.
tgt_text: zwi khwaṱhisa khanedzano nga tshitshavha zwa ri fha roṱhe u pfesesa ho ṱanḓavhuwaho ha zwithu zwine zwa khou itea.

src_text: we have consistently maintained that we rely on scientific, economic and empirical data when it comes to making decisions and formulating regulations around our coronavirus response.
tgt_text: ro dzulela u amba zwauri ri ḓitika nga data ya vhukuma, ya zwa ikonomi na ya saithifiki musi zwi tshi ḓa kha u dzhia tsheo na u sika milayo malugana na phindulo yashu kha tshitzhili tsha corona.

src_text: to the greatest extent possible under these challenging circumstances, we aim for consultation and engagement.
tgt_text: ho sedzwa khonadzeo khulwane dzine dza vha hone kha nyimele hedzi dzi dziedzaho, ro lavhelela u ita vhukwamani na nyambedzano.

src_text: we want all south africans to be part of this national effort.
tgt_text: ri ṱoḓa vhathu vhoṱhe vha afrika tshipembe vha tshi vha tshipiḓa tsha vhuḓidini uhu ha lushaka.

src_text: the voices of ordinary citizens must continue to be heard at a time as critical as this.
tgt_text: maipfi a vhadzulapo zwavho a tea u dzulela u pfiwa kha tshifhinga tsha ndeme tshi fanaho na hetshi.

src_text: the coronavirus pandemic and the measures we have taken to combat it have taken a heavy toll on our people.
tgt_text: dwadze ḽa tshitzhili tsha corona na maga e ra a dzhia u lwisana naḽo zwo pfisa vhuṱungu vhukuma vhathu vhashu.

src_text: it has caused huge disruption and hardship.
tgt_text: zwo vhanga u khakhisea ha zwithu na vhuleme vhuhulu.

src_text: although we can point to the progress we have made in delaying the transmission of the virus, there is still a long way to go.
tgt_text: naho ri tshi nga sumba mvelaphanḓa dze ra dzi ita u lengisa phiriso ya vairasi, vhuiwa vhu tshe kule.

src_text: the weeks and months ahead will be difficult and will demand much more from our people.
tgt_text: miṅwedzi na vhege dzi re phanḓa zwi ḓo lemela nahone zwi ḓo ṱoḓa vhunzhi ha zwithu kha vhathu vhashu.

src_text: the pandemic will therefore continue to place an enormous strain on our society and our institutions.
tgt_text: dwadze ngauralo ḽi ḓo isa phanḓa na u vhea mutsiko muhulu kha tshitshavha tshashu na kha zwiimiswa zwashu.

src_text: even as we gradually open up the economy, the impact on people’s material conditions will be severe.
tgt_text: naho ri tshi khou vula ikonomi nga zwiṱuku, u kwamea kha nyimele dza thundu dza vhathu hu ḓo vha huhulu.

src_text: for as long as this is the case, the potential for conflict, discord and dissatisfaction will remain.
tgt_text: arali mafhungo aya ri tshe ro livhana nao, khonadzeo ya khuḓano, u shaya pfano na u sa fushea zwi ḓo dzula zwi hone.

src_text: as we navigate these turbu lent waters, our constitution is our most important guide and our most valued protection.
tgt_text: musi ri tshi khou sumba nḓila gabelo iḽi ḽi ofhisaho, ndayotewa yashu ndi nyendedzi yashu ya ndeme na tshitsireledzi tshashu tshi ṱhonifheaho vhukuma.

src_text: our robust democracy provides the strength and the resilience we need to overcome this deep crisis.
tgt_text: dimokirasi yashu yo khwaṱhaho i ri ṋetshedza nungo na maanḓa ane ra a ṱoḓa u kunda khakhathi iyi i konḓaho vhukuma.

src_text: just as government appreciates that most court appli cants are motivated by the common good, so too should we recognise that the decisions taken by government are made in good faith and are meant to advance, and not to harm, the interests of south africans.
tgt_text: musi muvhuso u tshi dzhiela nṱha uri vhunzhi ha vhaiti vha khumbelo khothe vha ṱuṱuwedzwa nga zwi vhuedzaho vhathu vhoṱhe, na zwenezwo ri tea u ṱalusa uri tsheo dzo dzhiwaho nga muvhuso dzi kwao nahone dzo itelwa u bveledzisa, hu si u vhaisa madzangalelo a maafrika tshipembe.

src_text: our foremost priority remains to save lives.
tgt_text: tsha ndemesa kha riṋe ndi u dzulela u phulusa matshilo.

src_text: our every decision is informed by the need to advance the rights to life and dignity as set out in our constitution.
tgt_text: tsheo yashu iṅwe na iṅwe i langwa nga ṱhoḓea ya u bveledzisa pfanelo dza vhutshilo na tshirunzi sa zwe zwa dzulisa zwone kha ndayotewa yashu.

src_text: we will continue to welcome different – even dissenting – viewpoints around our national coronavirus response.
tgt_text: ri ḓo isa phanḓa na u ṱanganedza mihumbulo yo fhambanaho – nangwe i thungo kha ya vhaṅwe malugana na phindulo yashu ya lushaka kha tshitzhili tsha corona.

src_text: all viewpoints aid us and help us to work better and smarter.
tgt_text: mihumbulo yoṱhe i ri thusa u shuma khwiṋe nahone zwavhuḓi.

src_text: the exercise of the fundamental freedoms of expression, association and speech is a barometer of the good health of our democracy.
tgt_text: nḓowelo ya u shumisa mbofholowo dza vhuḓipfi, nyanḓano na u amba ndi tshikalo tsha mutakalo wavhuḓi wa dimokirasi yashu.

src_text: but much more than that, these rights are essential to the success of our national and collective struggle to overcome the coronavirus.
tgt_text: dimokirasi yashu i ḓo ri thusa u kunda covid 19 vukuzenzele unnamed ri dzulela u dzhiela fhasi dimokirasi yashu yo khwaṱhaho nahone yavhuḓi.

src_text: sa moves to alert level 3 vukuzenzele unnamed president cyril rama phosa has announced that south africa has moved to level 3 with effect from 1 june with more sectors of the economy opening and the removal of a number of restrictions on the movement of people.
tgt_text: afrika tshipembe ḽo pfukela kha ḽevele ya 3 vukuzenzele unnamed muphuresidennde vho cyril ramaphosa vho ḓivhadza zwauri afrika tshipembe ḽi khou ḓo pfukela kha ḽevele ya 3 u thoma nga ḽa 01 fulwi – hune sekhi thara nnzhi dza ikonomi dza khou ḓo vula na u bviswa ha tshivhalo tsha nyiledzo kha u tshimbila ha vhathu.

src_text: addressing the nation re cently on the developments in south africa’s riskadjusted strategy to manage the spread of the coronavirus (covid19), the president says the country will have a differentiated approach to deal with areas that have far higher levels of infection and transmission.
tgt_text: zwenezwino musi vha tshi khou amba na lushaka nga ha mveledziso dza tshiṱirathedzhi tsha khwinifhadzo ya khonadzeo ya khombo tsha afrika tshipembe u langa u phaḓalala ha (covid19), muphuresi dennde vho amba zwauri shango ḽi ḓo shumisa maitele o fhambanyiswaho u sedzana na vhupo vhune ha vha na tshiimo tshi re nṱhesa tsha u kavhiwa na phiriselo.

src_text: covid19 hotspotsthese areas have been de clared as coronavirus disease hotspots.
tgt_text: tshivhilelani tsha covid19vhupo uvhu ho ḓivhadzwa sa tshivhilelani tsha tshitzhili tsha corona.

src_text: they include the following metros: city of tshwane city of johannesburg ekurhuleni ethekwini nelson mandela bay buffalo city cape town.
tgt_text: vhu katela ḓorobo khulwane dzi tevhelaho: ḓorobo ya tshwane ḓorobo ya johannesburg ekurhuleni ethekwini nelson mandela bay buffalo city na cape town.

src_text: other areas that have been identified as hotspots are the west coast, overberg and cape winelands district municipalities in the western cape, chris hani district in the eastern cape and ilembe district in kwazulunatal.
tgt_text: vhupo vhuṅwe he ha ṱaluswa sa tshivhilelani ndi mimasipala ya tshiṱiriki tsha phendelashango ya vhukovhela, overberg na cape winelands ngei kapa vhukovhela, tshiṱiriki tsha chris hani ngei kapa vhubvaḓuvha, na tshiṱiriki tsha ilembe ngei kwazulunatal.

src_text: a hotspot is defined as an area that has more than five infected people per every 100 000 people or where new infections are increasing at a fast pace.
tgt_text: tshivhilelani hu ṱalutshedzwa sa vhupo vhune ha vha na vhathu vha fhiraho vhaṱanu vho kavhiwaho kha vhathu vha 100 000 zwiṅwe na zwiṅwe kana hune u kavhiwa ha vha hu khou gonya nga luvhilo.

src_text: to deal with the virus in these areas, government will implement intensive interventions aimed at decreasing the number of new infections.
tgt_text: u imedzana na vairasi kha vhupo uvhu, muvhuso u ḓo thoma u ṋetshedza thusedzo khulwanesa wo sedza kha u tsitsela fhasi tshivhalo tshiswa tsha vha kavhiwaho.

src_text: "we are putting in place enhanced measures of surveillance, infection control and management.
tgt_text: muphuresidennde vho amba uri: "ri khou vhea maga a vhulavhelesi o khwiniswaho, ndaulo na ndango ya u kavhiwa.

src_text: we will assign a fulltime team of experienced personnel to each hotspot," the president says.
tgt_text: ri ḓo vhea tshigwada tsha vhashumi vha re na tshenzhemo vha tshifhinga tshoṱhe kha vhupo huṅwe na huṅwe hune ha vha tshivhilelani.’’tshigwada itshi tshi ḓo katela vhaḓivhi vho gudelaho malwadze a no ṱaha vhathuni, madokotela, manese, vhashumi vha zwa mutakalo vha tshitshavha, vhaḓivhi vha zwa mutakalo wa lushaka na tshumelo ya zwa mutakalo ya shishi, tshi ḓo tikedzwa nga vhaḓivhi vha zwa dzilafho vha cuba.

src_text: this team will include epidemiologists, family practition ers, nurses, community health workers, public health experts and emergency medical services, to be supported by cuban experts.
tgt_text: "ri ḓo ṱumanya vhupo ha tshivhilelani huṅwe na huṅwe na tshumelo dza u linga, zwiimiswa zwa u ḓikhethela thungo, zwiimiswa zwa khwaranthini, dzilafho, mimbete ya sibadela na u londa vho kwamanaho na muthu o kavhiwaho.

src_text: "we will link each hotspot to testing services, isolation facilities, quarantine facilities, treatment, hospital beds and contact tracing.
tgt_text: vho amba uri: "arali zwa nga itea, tshipiḓa tshiṅwe na tshiṅwe tsha shango tshi nga humiselwa kha ḽevele ya 4 kana ya 5 arali u phaḓalala ha phiriso ha sa langea naho ro ṋetshedza thusedzo nahone hu na khonadzeo ya khombo ya u ḓalesa ha vhalwadze hu sa langeiho kha zwiimiswa zwashu zwa mutakalo.’’mutevhe wa vhupo ha tshivhilelani vhu ḓo sedzuluswa vhege mbili dziṅwe na dziṅwe zwi tshi bva kha mvelaphanḓa ya vairasi.

src_text: "should it be necessary, any part of the country could be returned to alert levels 4 or 5 if the spread of infection is not contained despite our interventions and there is a risk of our health facilities being overwhelmed," he says.
tgt_text: u vula ikonomiu dzhena kha ḽevele ya 3 hune ha ḓo thoma nga ḽa 1 fulwi, hu katela u humela mushumoni ha sekhithara dza ikonomi nnzhi, hu tshi khou tevhedzwa phurothokhoḽo dza zwa mutakalo dzo khwaṱhaho na milayo ya zwa u sia tshikhala vhukati ha muthu na muṅwe.

src_text: the list of hotspot areas will be reviewed every two weeks depending on the progression of the virus.
tgt_text: vhashumeli vha tshitshavha vhanzhi na vhone vho humela mushumoni zwi tshi ya nga mbetshelwa dza mulayo wa tsireledzo na mutakalo wa vhashumi mushumoni na nga nyendedzi dza muhasho wa tshumelo dza vhathu na ndaulo, i tshi khou shumisana na miṅwe mihasho yoṱhe kha muvhuso.

src_text: opening the economythe implementation of alert level 3 which started at the beginning of june, involved the return to operation of most sectors of the econo my, subject to observance of strict health protocols and social distancing rules.
tgt_text: nzudzanyo dza mushumoni na phurothokhoḽomusi sekhithara nnzhi dza ikonomi dzo vula, muvhuso u ḓo ḓitika nga vhukwamani na lushaka u tshi khou shumisana na vhashumisani vhoṱhe vha ndeme u lugisa zwithu zwa ndeme zwi re na khonadzeo ya khombo mushumoni hu na vhuṱumani vhukati ha vhashumi na tshitshavha.

src_text: more public servants have also returned to work in accordance with provisions of the occupational health and safety act and as guided by the department of public service and administration, working together with all other departments in government.
tgt_text: vho amba uri: "ngauralo ri ḓo vha ri tshi khou khunyeledza tshivhalo tsha phurothokhoḽo dza sekhithara nahone ri ḓo ṱoḓa khamphani iṅwe na iṅwe i tshi bveledza nzudzanyo ya mushumoni musi vha sa athu vula.’’u ya nga nzudzanyo hedzi, khamphani dzi ḓo tea u dzudzanya zwishumiswa na maga a zwa u sia tshikhala vhukati ha muthu na muṅwe na zwa vhuthathatzhili; vha ḓo tea u ṱola vhashumi musi vha tshi swika mushumoni ḓuvha ḽiṅwe na ḽiṅwe, ya khethela thungo avho vhane vha ḓo vha vho kavhiwa na u ita nzudzanyo dza uri vha itwe ndingo.

src_text: protocols and workplace plansas more sectors of the econ omy open, government will rely on social compacts with all key role players to address the key risk factors at the workplace and in the interface between employees and the public.
tgt_text: muphuresidennde vho amba uri: "dzi ḓo tea u thusa nga u londa vhoṱhe vho kwamanaho na muthu o kavhiwaho arali vhashumi vho itwa ndingo vha wanala vhe phosethivi.

src_text: "we will therefore be finalising a number of sector protocols and will require every company to develop a workplace plan before they reopen," he says.
tgt_text: nga mulandu wa u nga ḓo balelwa u ḓitsireledza, vhashumi vhoṱhe vhane vha na vhukale ha miṅwaha i fhiraho 60 na avho vha re na nyimele dza malwadze a tshifhinga tshilapfu u fana na vhulwadze ha mbilu, swigiri, vhulwadze ha kufemele vhu sa fholiho na khentsa vha tea u dzula hayani.

src_text: according to these plans, companies will need to put in place sanitary and social distancing measures and facilities; they will need to screen workers on arrival each day, quarantine those who may be infected and make arrangements for them to be tested.
tgt_text: vhashumi vhane vha nga shuma vhe hayani vha tea u tendelwa vha ita ngauralo.

src_text: "they also need to assist with contact tracing if employees test positive.
tgt_text: ho sedzwa maga haya, tshumelo dzoṱhe dza vhubveledzi, migodi, dza zwa u fhaṱa, dza zwa masheleni, phurofeshinaḽa na vhubindudzi, thekinoḽodzhi ya zwa mafhungo, vhudavhidzani, tshumelo dza muvhuso na vhoramafhungo, dzi ḓo vulwa u bva nga ḽa 01 fulwi.

src_text: because of their vulnerability, all staff who are older than 60 years of age and those who suffer from underlying conditions such as heart disease, diabetes, chronic respiratory disease and cancer should ideally stay at home," the president says.
tgt_text: nzudzanyo dzo teaho dza u vula nga huswa u ya nga luṱa nga luṱa dzi ḓo tea u itwa mushumoni muṅwe na muṅwe.

src_text: employees who can work from home should be allowed to do so.
tgt_text: vho amba uri: "mabindu maṱuku na holosela zwi ḓo vula tshoṱhe, zwi tshi katela mavhengele, zwiphaza na vhavhambadzi zwavho.

src_text: subject to these measures, all manufacturing, mining, construction, financial services, professional and business services, information technology, com munications, government services and media services, reopened from 1 june.
tgt_text: mbambadzo nga eḽekithroniki dzi ḓo dzula dzi hone.

src_text: the appropriate restart and phasing in arrangements will need to be put in place for every workplace.
tgt_text: sekhithara dziṅwe dze dza vula tshifhinga tsho fhiraho, dzi ngaho sa vhulimi na zwa maḓaka, tshumelo dza masipala na muvhuso, tshumelo dza zwa dzilafho, mveledziso ya zwiḽiwa na vhubveledzi ha zwibveledzwa zwa tsiravhulwadze, zwi ḓo dzula zwo vula tshoṱhe.’’mishumo ya mveledziso ya ikonomi i re na khonadzeo ya khombo khulwane yo iledzwamishumo ya mveledziso ya ikonomi i re na khonadzeo ya khombo i re nṱha i ḓo dzula yo iledzwa.

src_text: "wholesale and retail trade will be fully opened, including stores, spaza shops and informal traders.
tgt_text: izwi zwi katela: dziresitorente, dzibara na dzithaveni, nga nnḓani ha u tou isa kana u ḓa wa dzhia zwiḽiwa wa ṱuwa.

src_text: ecommerce will continue to remain open.
tgt_text: madzulo na u enda tshikhalani nga mabupo a fhano hayani, nga nnḓani ha u enda kha zwa mushumo, zwine zwa ḓo dzheniswa nga maḓuvha ane a ḓo ḓivhadzwa.

src_text: other sectors that opened previous ly, such as agriculture and forestry, utilities, medical services, food production and manufacture of hygiene products, will remain fully opened," he says.
tgt_text: khonferentsi, vhuṱambo, vhumvumvusi, na zwa mitambo.

src_text: highrisk economic activities prohibitedhighrisk economic activi ties will remain prohibited.
tgt_text: tshumelo dza ndondolo ya muthu ene muṋe, zwi tshi katela tshumelo dza zwa lunako na u ita mavhudzi.

src_text: these include: restaurants, bars and taverns, except for delivery or collection of food.
tgt_text: u tshimbila ha vhathu na u rengisa zwikambivhathu vha ḓo tendelwa u ita nyonyoloso tshifhinga tshiṅwe na tshiṅwe, tenda zwa sa itwe nga tshigwada.

src_text: accommodation and domestic air travel, except for business travel, which will be phased in on dates to be announced.
tgt_text: nyiledzo dza u tshimbila ha vhathu nga zwifhinga zwo tiwaho zwi ḓo fheliswa.

src_text: conferences, events, entertainment and sporting activities.
tgt_text: muphuresidennde vho amba uri: "zwikambi zwi ḓo rengiswa zwa nwelwa mahayani fhedzi zwi fhasi ha maga o khwaṱhaho vhukuma, nahone kha maḓuvha o tendelwaho na nga awara dzo pimiwaho.

src_text: personal care services, including hairdressing and beauty services.
tgt_text: nḓivhadzo malugana na izwi i ḓo itwa musi ro no khunyeledza nyambedzano na vha sekhithara iyi nga ha maitele o fhambanaho.

src_text: movement of people and sale of alcoholpeople will be able to exer cise at any time during the day, provided this is not done in groups.
tgt_text: "u rengisa zwibveledzwa zwa fola zwi ḓo dzula zwo iledzwa kha ḽevele ya 3, nga mulandu wa khonadzeo ya khombo kha mutakalo ine ya ṱumanywa na u daha.

src_text: the curfew on the movement of people will be lifted.
tgt_text: vho amba uri: "maguvhangano oṱhe a ḓo dzula o iledzwa, nga nnḓani ha mbulungo dzine dzi tea u vha na vhathu vha sa fhiriho 50 kana miṱangano mushumoni ine ya vha na ndivho ya zwa mushumo fhedzi."

src_text: "alcohol may be sold for home consumption only under strict conditions, on specified days and for limited hours.
tgt_text: kha vha lavhelele u gonya ha u kavhiwa nga vhulwadze muphuresidennde vho ramaphosa vho amba uri, musi hu tshi khou dzudzanyelwa u gonya ho lavhelelwaho ha u kavhiwa nga covid19 kha shango, mimbete ya sibadela ya henefha kha 20 000 i hone, nahone i ḓo shumiselwa vhalwadze vha covid19, na zwibadela zwa tshifhinga nyana u itela ndondolo ya shishi zwa 27 zwi khou fhaṱwa u mona na shango.

src_text: announcements in this regard will be made once we have concluded discussions with the sector on the various conditions," the president says.
tgt_text: "tshivhalo tsha zwibadela izwi zwo lugela u ṱanganedza vhalwadze vha tshitzhili tsha corona."

src_text: the sale of tobacco products will remain prohibited in alert level 3, due to the health risks associated with smoking.
tgt_text: muphuresidennde vho amba uri muvhuso u livhuwa mushumo une wa khou ya phanḓa na u itwa nga vhashumeli vha tshitshavha, nga maanḓa avho vhane vha tou vha mbali kha u lwisana na covid19.

src_text: "all gatherings will remain prohibited, except for funerals with no more than 50 people or meetings in the workplace for work purposes," he says.
tgt_text: "tsireledzo ya vhashumi vhoṱhe, zwi tshi katela vhashumi vha muvhuso, tshi tou vha tshithu tsha ndeme kha riṋe.

src_text: expect rise in infectionspresident ramaphosa says, in preparation for the expected increase in covid19 infections in the country, around 20 000 hospital beds have been, and are being, repurposed for covid19 cases, and 27 field hospitals are being built around the country.
tgt_text: ri ḓo isa phanḓa u ita ndingedzo dzoṱhe ri tshi itela ṋetshedzo yo teaho ya zwishumiswa zwa tsireledzo zwa muthu ene muṋe u vhona uri muthu muṅwe na muṅwe o tsireledzea musi e mushumoni.

src_text: "a number of these hospitals are ready to receive coronavirus patients."
tgt_text: vho amba uri: "tsha ndemesa kha riṋe ndi u fhungudza zwikhala zwa phiriso ya vairasi na u ita vhupo ho tsireledzeaho kha muṅwe na muṅwe.

src_text: the president says government appreciates the work that continues to be done by public servants, especially those in the front line in the fight against covid19.
tgt_text: tsivhudzo dzine vha tea u tevhela u thivhela u kavhiwa nga tshitzhili tsha corona .

src_text: "the safety of all workers, including public servants, is a matter of concern to us.
tgt_text: »kha vha dzule hayani nga nḓila dzoṱhe dzine dza konadzea.

src_text: we will continue to make all efforts for the adequate provision of personal protection equipment to ensure safety for everyone while at work.
tgt_text: »vha humbule u sia tshikhala vhukati ha vhone na muṅwe muthu.

src_text: "our priority is to reduce the opportunities for the transmission of the virus and create a safe environment for everyone," he says.
tgt_text: »kha vha ambare masiki wavho.

tgt_text: vha ṱanzwe nga murahu ha zwanḓa zwavho, vhukati ha minwe na ngomu ha ṋala.

tgt_text: afrika tshipembe ḽo pfukela kha ḽevele ya 3 vukuzenzele unnamed muphuresidennde vho cyril ramaphosa vho ḓivhadza zwauri afrika tshipembe ḽi khou ḓo pfukela kha ḽevele ya 3 u thoma nga ḽa 01 fulwi – hune sekhi thara nnzhi dza ikonomi dza khou ḓo vula na u bviswa ha tshivhalo tsha nyiledzo kha u tshimbila ha vhathu.

src_text: sa youth are a source of inspiration and hope vukuzenzele unnamed the words of frantz fanon that ‘each generation must discover its mission’ come to mind every time i have an opportunity to speak with young south africans.
tgt_text: vhaswa vha sa ndi vhubvo ha ṱhuṱhuwedzo na fulufhelo vukuzenzele unnamed maipfi a uri ‘murafho muṅwe na muṅwe u fanela u tumbula mishini wawo’ a ḓa muhumbuloni tshifhinga tshoṱhe ndi tshi wana tshikhala tsha u amba na vhaswa vha afrika tshipembe.

src_text: no matter where they live and no matter what they do, they each have a burning desire to change the world.
tgt_text: hu si na ndavha uri vha dzula ngafhi na uri vha ita mini, muṅwe na muṅwe u na vhudugambilu ha u shandukisa ḽifhasi.

src_text: while they certainly want to improve their own lives, they also want to achieve a better society and a better world.
tgt_text: musi zwi zwone uri vha ṱoḓa u khwinisa matshilo a vhone vhaṋe, vha dovha vha ṱoḓa u swikela tshitshavha tsha khwine na ḽifhasi ḽa khwine.

src_text: they see themselves as agents for fundamental transformation.
tgt_text: vha ḓivhona sa mazhendedzi a tshanduko ya mutheo.

src_text: throughout history young people have been a driving force for change.
tgt_text: kha ḓivhazwakale yoṱhe vhaswa vho dzulela u vha vharangaphanḓa vha tshanduko.

src_text: in just the last few decades, young people have waged numerous struggles against injustice, from the 1968 student uprising in paris, to the antiwar movement in the united states in the 1960s, to the anticolonial struggle in many african and asian countries, to the fight against apartheid, to the arab spring.
tgt_text: kha miṅwaha ya fumi i si gathi yo fhiraho, vhaswa vho tshimbidza mafulo a nndwa o vhalaho a vhushayavhulamukanyi, u bva kha mugwalabo wa matshudeni wa 1968 ngei paris, u ya kha dzangano ḽi hanedzanaho na dzinndwa ngei united state miṅwahani ya 1960, u ya kha nndwa ya u lwa na vhukoḽoni kha mashango manzhi a afrika na asia, u ya kha nndwa na muvhuso wa tshiṱalula, u ya kha arab spring.

src_text: most recently, young people have been at the forefront of the #blacklivesmatter movement that has gained global support in the wake of the killing of george floyd in the united states.
tgt_text: zwenezwino, vhaswa vho vha vhone vhe vha ranga phanḓa fulo ḽa #blacklivesmatter ḽe ḽa wana thikhedzo ḽifhasini u bva kha bulayo ḽa tshiṱuhu ḽa vho george floyd ngei united states.

src_text: over the past few weeks, activists around the world have also been demanding the removal of symbols that glorify the barbarity and violence of the slave trade and colonialism.
tgt_text: kha vhege dzi si gathi dzo fhiraho, vhalwelatshanduko u mona na ḽifhasi vho dovha vha ṱoḓa nga khani u bviswa ha zwiga zwi hulisaho zwiito zwa tshiṱuhu na khakhathi dza mbambadzo ya phuli na zwa vhukoḽoni.

src_text: at an oxford university demonstration recently a protestor carried a placard with the words ‘rhodes must fall’, the rallying cry of students in our own country five years ago.
tgt_text: kha migwalabo ya ngei oxford university ya zwenezwino mugwalabi o hwala puḽakhadi i na maipﬁ a ‘rhodes must fall’, tshe tsha vha tshi tshililo tsha fulo ḽa matshudeni kha shango ḽashu mihwahani miṱanu yo fhiraho.

src_text: young people across the world have found common cause.
tgt_text: vhaswa u mona na ḽifhasi vho wana tshilwelwa tshi fanaho.

src_text: they are tearing down statues and symbols of racism, demanding the decolonisation of educational curricula, and calling for institutions to address racism and social exclusion.
tgt_text: vha khou wisa na u kwashekanya zwiṱetshu na zwiga zwa khethululo nga muvhala, vha ṱoḓa u bviswa kha ndaulo ya kharikhuḽamu ya zwa pfunzo ya vhukoḽoni, na u ita khuwelelo kha zwiimiswa uri zwi tandulule fhungo ḽa khethululo nga muvhala na u sa katelwa kha sisṱeme dza matshilisano.

src_text: and so, as we paid tribute to the generation of 1976 on 16 june 2020, we also salute the youth of postapartheid south africa, the worthy inheritors of this noble legacy.
tgt_text: ngauralo, musi ri khou elelwa murafho wa 1976 nga ḽa 16 fulwi 2020, ri dovha ra ṱhonifha vhaswa vha nga murahu ha muvhuso wa tshiṱalula afrika tshipembe, vhaḽaifa vho teaho vha ifa iḽi ḽa mikhwa yavhuḓi.

src_text: the mission of 1976 generation was to dismantle bantu education; that of today’s youth is to take forward the project of national reconciliation and transformation.
tgt_text: mishini wa murafho wa 1976 ho vha hu u fhelisa pfunzo ya ‘bantu’; fhedzi ya vhaswa vha zwino ndi u isa phanḓa thandela ya pfumedzano na tshandukiso ya lushaka.

src_text: in time to come it will be said that this year, 2020, marked the start of a new epoch in human history.
tgt_text: kha tshifhinga tshi ḓaho hu ḓo ambiwa uri ṅwaha uno, wa 2020, wo swaya mathomo a tshifhinga tshiswa kha ḓivhazwakale ya muthu.

src_text: not only has coronavirus had a momentous impact on people’s lives and livelihoods, it has also shaken up the global social order.
tgt_text: tshitzhili tsha corona a tshi ngo vha na masiandaitwa mahulwanesa kha matshilo a vhathu na nḓila ya u kona u ḓitshelela fhedzi, fhedzi tsho dovha tsha dzinginya nzudzanyo ya ḽifhasi ya matshilisano.

src_text: the manner in which the pandemic has taken hold has been a reminder of the interconnectedness of the human race and of the deep inequalities that exist between countries and within countries.
tgt_text: nga nḓila ye dwadze ḽa dzhia ngayo ndaulo ndi khumbudzo ya vhuṱumani ha lushaka lwa vhathu na vhushayandingano huhulwanesa hune ha vha hone vhukati ha mashango na nga ngomu ha mashango.

src_text: the pandemic presents an opportunity to ‘reset’ a world that is characterised by crass materialism, selfishness and selfabsorption not just on the part of individuals but whole societies.
tgt_text: dwadze ḽi ṋetshedza tshikhala tsha u ‘vusa nga huswa’ ḽifhasi ḽo vhumbwaho nga ndaka kana thundu fhedzi hu si na vhuṱali, u humbulela iwe muṋe fhedzi na u sedza iwe muṋe fhedzi hu si kha sia ḽa vhathu fhedzi, fhedzi na kha zwitshavha nga u angaredza.

src_text: young people are telling us that the essential values of integrity, compassion and solidarity must be the hallmarks of the new society that will emerge, and that they are determined to be the champions of this new, better world.
tgt_text: vhaswa vha khou ri vhudza uri mikhwa ya mutheo wa vhungoho, u pfela vhuṱungu na vhuthihi zwi fanela u vha zwiganḓo zwa tshitshavha tshiswa tshine tsha ḓo bvelela, na u ḓiimisela u vha dzingweṋa dza ḽifhasi iḽi ḽiswa ḽa khwine.

src_text: in the discussions i have had with young people i have said that we should never underestimate the power of an idea, because ideas can and have changed the world.
tgt_text: kha nyambedzano dze nda vha nadzo na vhaswa ndo amba uri a ri tei u dzhiela fhasi maanḓa a muhumbulo, ngauri muhumbulo u nga kha ḓi, nahone wo shandukisa ḽifhasi.

src_text: ideas have spurred human progress and they are what will enable us to chart a new path in the postcoronavirus era.
tgt_text: mihumbulo yo ṱuṱuwedza mvelaphanḓa ya muthu nahone ndi yone ine ya ḓo ri konisa u rekhoda nḓila ntswa kha tshifhinga tshi ḓaho tsha nga murahu ha tshitzhili tsha corona.

src_text: these young people have turned their ideas into action.
tgt_text: vhaswa avha vha shandukisa mihumbulo yavho ya vha nyito.

src_text: they have not let a lack of resources hinder them.
tgt_text: a vha ngo tendela ṱhahelelo ya zwiko i tshi vha ima phanḓa.

src_text: they have carved a niche for themselves in a number of sectors from hightech to environmental sustainability.
tgt_text: vho ḓisikela zwikhala vhone vhaṋe kha sekhithara dzo vhalaho u bva kha dzi shumisaho thekhinoḽodzhi u ya kha ṱhogomelo yo khwaṱhaho ya zwa mupo.

src_text: now more than ever we will look to the innovative and pioneering spirit of our youth to come up with solutions to the unemployment crisis that benefit them, their communities and society.
tgt_text: zwino u fhira na mathomoni ri sedza kha muya wa zwa vhutumbuli na wa u lingedza zwithu zwiswa nga vhaswa vhashu uri vha ḓe na thandululo dza thaidzo dza vhushayamushumo dzine dza ḓo vhuedza vhone vhaṋe, zwitshavha zwavho na vhadzulapo.

src_text: at the same time, i challenge our country’s youth to craft and design programmes that will enable us to meet our developmental goals.
tgt_text: nga tshifhinga tshenetshi, ndi itela khaedu vhaswa vha shango ḽashu u sika na u ola mbekanyamushumo dzine dza ḓo ri ita uri ri swikele zwipikwa zwashu zwa mveledziso.

src_text: in 1961, revolutionary cuba sent legions of young student volunteers into the mountains and villages to construct schools, teach literacy and train new educators.
tgt_text: nga 1961, shango ḽa cuba ḽo wanaho tshanduko, ḽo rumela gogo ḽa matshudeni a vhaswa vha sa shumeli malamba u ya dzithavhani na miḓanani u fhaṱa zwikolo, u funza u vhala na u ṅwala na u pfumbudza vhagudisi vhaswa.

src_text: it is still held up as one of the most successful literacy campaigns in modern history.
tgt_text: u swika zwino, ḽi kha ḓi dzhiiwa sa ḽiṅwe ḽa mafulo a u gudisa u ṅwala na u vhala a dzhielwaho nṱha e a bvelela vhukuma kha ḓivhazwakale u swika zwino.

src_text: our young people must develop social upliftment initiatives and they must lead them.
tgt_text: vhaswa vhashu vha fanela u bveledzisa vhurangeli ha u khwinifhadza matshilo nahone vha fanela u vhu ranga phanḓa.

src_text: just as they took up the struggle for equality in higher education, the considerable energies of our youth must also be brought to bear to fight for equitable access to health care, for the transformation of land ownership and, most importantly, for gender justice.
tgt_text: sa musi vha tshi dzhia nndwa ya ndinganyiso ya pfunzo ya nṱha, mafulufulu mahulwane a vhaswa vhashu a fanela u dovha a shumiswa kha u lwa nndwa ya tswikelelo i linganaho ya ndondolo ya mutakalo, u itela tshanduko na vhuṋe ha mavu, zwa vhuṱhogwa vhukuma, kha vhulamukanyi ha zwa mbeu.

src_text: like all south africans, i have been deeply disturbed by a surge in the murder of young women at the hands of men.
tgt_text: u fana na maafrika tshipembe vhoṱhe, ndo vhaiswa vhukuma nga u hulela ha mabulayo a vhafumakadzana zwanḓani zwa vhanna.

src_text: these are shocking acts of inhumanity that have no place in our society.
tgt_text: hezwi ndi zwiito zwi shushaho zwa tshiṱuhu tshihulu nahone a zwi ṱanganedzei na luthihi kha shango ḽashu.

src_text: youthled civic activism, awareness raising and peer counselling are vital tools in our efforts to eradicate genderbased violence from society.
tgt_text: vhulwelatshanduko ha vhadzulapo ho rangwaho phanḓa nga vhaswa, u ḓisa tsivhudzo na khuthadzo nga mirole ndi zwishumiswa zwa vhuṱhogwa kha ndingedzo dzashu dza u fhelisa khakhathi dzo livhiswaho kha mbeu u bva kha tshitshavha.

src_text: at the same time, we must strengthen our justice system, ensuring that perpetrators are brought to book, bail and parole conditions are tightened and that those sentenced to life spend the rest of their lives behind bars.
tgt_text: nga tshifhinga tshenetshi, ri fanela u khwaṱhisa sisṱeme dzashu dza vhulamukanyi, u khwaṱhisedza uri vhatshinyi vha khou fariwa, milayo ya beiḽi na paruḽa i khou vhofhiwa ya khwaṱha na uri avho vhane vha gwevhiwa u dzula dzhele vhutshilo havho hoṱhe vha fhedza matshilo avho vho valelwa dzhele.

src_text: while this needs societywide action, i call on young men in particular to take up the struggle against genderbased violence.
tgt_text: musi izwi zwi tshi ṱoḓa vhukando ha tshitshavha nga vhuphara, ndi ita khuwelo kha vhanna vha vhaswa nga maanḓa kha u lwisa khakhathi dzo ḓisendekaho nga mbeu.

src_text: unless we end the war that is being waged against south african women, the dream of a new society will remain elusive.
tgt_text: arali ra sa fhelisa nndwa ine ya khou itelwa vhafumakadzi vha afrika tshipembe, muḽoro wa tshitshavha tshiswa u ḓo dzula u ḽifhedzi.

src_text: those of us who were part of student movements during the apartheid era are often asked what we think of the young people of today.
tgt_text: riṋe re ra vha ri tshipiḓa tsha madzangano a matshudeni nga tshifhinga tsha muvhuso wa tshiṱalula ri dzulela u vhudziswa uri ri humbula mini nga vhaswa vha ano maḓuvha.

src_text: there is a temptation to retreat into nostalgia about ‘the glory days’ of student politics and youth struggle, never to be replicated.
tgt_text: hu na mulingo wa u humela murahu kha lutamo lwa kale nga ha ‘maḓuvha a madakalo’ a polotiki dza matshudeni na nndwa ya vhaswa, hezwi a zwi tei u dovhololwa.

src_text: but just as the youth of yesteryear defined their mission, today’s youth have defined theirs.
tgt_text: fhedzi sa vhaswa vha miṅwaha yo fhiraho vho ṱalutshedza mishini wavho, vhaswa vha ṋamusi na vhone vho ṱalutshedza mishini wavho.

src_text: south african youth of 2020 more than meet the high standard set by their predecessors.
tgt_text: vhaswa vha afrika tshipembe vha 2020 vha swikela maimo a nṱha zwo tiwaho nga vho vha rangelaho phanḓa.

src_text: they are optimistic, resilient and courageous, often in the face of the harshest of circumstances.
tgt_text: vha na mafulufulu, vho ḓikumedzela na u vha na tshivhindi, kanzhi nga tshifhinga tsha nyimele dzi konḓesaho vhukuma.

src_text: they are a source of inspiration and hope.
tgt_text: vhaswa ndi vhubvo ha ṱhuṱhuwedzo na fulufhelo.

src_text: through their actions, they are building a world that is more just, equal, sustainable and at peace.
tgt_text: nga kha nyito dzavho, vha khou fhaṱa ḽifhasi ḽine ḽa vha na zwinzhi, ḽi linganaho, ḽo khwaṱhaho na u vha na mulalo.

src_text: young people across the world are calling on institutions to stop racism and social exclusion.
tgt_text: vhaswa vha sa ndi vhubvo ha ṱhuṱhuwedzo na fulufhelo vukuzenzele unnamed maipfi a uri ‘murafho muṅwe na muṅwe u fanela u tumbula mishini wawo’ a ḓa muhumbuloni tshifhinga tshoṱhe ndi tshi wana tshikhala tsha u amba na vhaswa vha afrika tshipembe.

src_text: mom with comorbidity beats covid19 silusapho nyanda insaaf mohammed says it is very important for south africans, especially those with comorbidities, to take responsibility for their health.
tgt_text: mme vha na malwadze a sa fholi vho kunda covid19 silusapho nyanda vho insaaf mohammed vhari ndi zwa ndeme vhukuma uri maafrika tshipembe nga mannḓa avho vha na malwadze a sa fholiho uri vha dzhie vhuḓifhinduleli ha mutakalo wavho.

src_text: people with comorbidities – such as asthma, hypertension, chronic kidney disease and diabetes – could experi ence more severe coro navirus (covid19) symptoms, and may even die as a result of the strain the virus puts on their bodies.
tgt_text: vhathu vha re na malwadze a sa fholiho – u fana na asima, mutsiko wa nṱha wa malofha vhulwadze ha tswio vhu sa fholiho na ha swigiri – vha nga tshenzhema tsumbadwadze dza covid19 dzi re khombo, nahone vha nga lovha nga vhanga ḽa mutsiko une tshitzhili tsha hwedza mivhili yavho.

src_text: fortunately, when cape townbased occupational therapist and mother of three insaaf mohammed (40) tested positive for covid19 while ill with asthma, she was able to manage both conditions and did not become seriously ill. mohammed contracted covid19 from her husband, who works at the groote schuur hospital’s laboratory.
tgt_text: mashudu mavhuya, musi occupational therapist na mme wa vhana vhararu vho insaaf mohammed (40) vho wanwa vha na covid19 musi vha na vhulwadze ha asima, vho kona u langa malwadze aya oṱhe nahone vha sa tou lwalesa.

src_text: mohammed’s sevenyearold son also tested positive.
tgt_text: vho mohammed vho wana covid19 kha munna wavho, vha shumaho laborithari ya sibadela tsha groote schuur.

src_text: after testing positive, all three selfisolated at home.
tgt_text: murwa wa vho mohammed wa miṅwaha ya sumbe na ene o ḓo kavhiwa nga dwadze.

src_text: "we selfisolated in our bedroom, while my motherinlaw – who has diabetes and hypertension and thankfully didn’t contract the virus – took care of our other two children," says mohammed.
tgt_text: nga murahu ha u wana uri vho kavhiwa, vhuraru havho vho ḓo ḓivalela hayani havho vha sa kwamane na vhaṅwe vhathu.

src_text: according to the western cape department of health, people with hypertension, diabetes and chronic kidney disease are among the most common comorbidity sufferers of covid19.
tgt_text: "ro ḓivalela kha lufhera lwa u eḓela, musi mazwale wanga – vhane vha vha na vhulwadze ha swigiri na mutsiko wa nṱha wa malofha, nga mashudu vha sa kavhiwe nga tshitzhili – vha ṱhogomela vhana vhashu vhaṅwe vhavhili," vho mohammed vha ralo.

src_text: as of 25 may, people with the following comorbidities showed serious symptoms of covid19; hypertension, 58 percent diabetes, 56 percent chronic kidney disease, 17 percent hiv , 16 percent asthma or chronic respiratory disease, 15 percent cardiac disease, 11 percent obesity, 13 percent tb, 13 percent cancer, two percent other chronic illnesses, 16 percent.
tgt_text: u ya nga muhasho wa mutakalo wa kapa vhukovhela, vhathu vha re na mutsiko wa nṱha wa malofha, vha re na vhulwadze ha swigiri na vhulwadze ha tswio vhu sa fholiho vha vhukati ha vhaṅwe vhalwadze vha re na malwadze a sa fholiho o ḓoweleaho vhukuma vha covid19.

src_text: mohammed says her worst fear was experiencing serious respiratory complications from covid19.
tgt_text: u bva nga ḽa 25 shundunthule, vhathu vha re na malwadze a sa fholiho a tevhelaho vho sumbedza tsumbadwadze dzi re khombo: mutsiko wa nṱha wa malofha, phesenthe dza 58 vhulwadze ha swigiri, phesenthe dza 56 vhulwadze ha tswio vhu sa fholiho, phesenthe dza 17 hiv , phesenthe dza16 asima kana vhulwadze ha zwa u fema vhu sa fholiho, phesenthe dza 15 vhulwadze vhu elanaho na ha mbilu, phesenthe dza 11 u vha na muvhili wo kalulaho, phesenthe dza 13 lufhia, phesenthe dza 13 khentsa, phesenthe mbili maṅwe malwadze a sa fholiho, phesenthe dza 16. vho mohammed vha ri nyofho dzavho khulwanesa ho vha u tshenzhema u hulela ha u konḓelwa vhukuma u fema ho vhangwaho nga covid19.

src_text: "i experienced tiredness, coughing and tightness of the chest, which my asthma pump resolved.
tgt_text: vha ri "ndo tshenzhema maneto, u hoṱola na u valea khanani, he phamphu yanga ya asima ya thusa.

src_text: my symptoms were not as severe as my husband’s, who had body aches, nausea, a tight chest, shortness of breath, blocked sinuses, thick phlegm on his chest and a fever.
tgt_text: tsumbadwadze dzanga dzo vha dzi sa tou vha khombo nga maanḓa u fana na dza munna wanga, vhe muvhili wavho wa vha u khou rema, vha tshi khou silingwa, khana yo valea, u fhelelwa nga mufemo, sainasi dzo thivha, tshilangwa tshidenya u bva khanani yavho na mufhiso muhulu.

src_text: my son had a fever for three days, but recovered quite fast once he overcame his symptoms," she says.
tgt_text: murwa wanga o vha na mufhiso muhulu lwa maḓuvha mararu, fhedzi a fhola nga u ṱavhanya musi tsumbadwadze dzawe dzi tshi fhela.

src_text: mohammed’s family had been following protocols at work and home, to avoid contracting the virus.
tgt_text: "muṱa wa vho mohammed wo tevhedza ndaela dzoṱhe dza tsiradwadze mushumoni na hayani, u thivhela u kavhiwa nga tshitzhili.

src_text: "my family was understanding, caring and supportive, and brought us supper every evening, but sometimes your community can be uncaring and the harm caused on social media is scary," says mohammed.
tgt_text: "muṱa wanga wo vha u tshi pfesesa, u ṋea ndondolo na thikhedzo, vha tshi ri ḓisela zwiḽiwa zwa tshilalelo madekwana maṅwe na maṅwe, fhedzi tshiṅwe tshifhinga tshitshavha tsha havho tshi nga kha ḓi sa londa, na vhuṱungu vhu vhangwaho nga nyanḓadzamafhungo ya matshilisano vhu a tshuwisa," vho ralo vho mohammed.

src_text: the western cape department of health says that keeping hydrated and monitoring your blood glucose, blood pressure and temperature are key to managing covid19, especially for patients with comorbidities.
tgt_text: muhasho wa mutakalo wa kapa vhukovhela uri u dzula u na maḓi muvhilini na u vhea iṱo swigiri malofhani, mutsiko wa malofha na thempharetsha ndi zwa vhuṱhogwa kha u langa covid19, nga maanḓa kha vhalwadze vha re na malwadze a sa fholiho.

src_text: in addition, the department advises people with comorbidities to: take medication correct ly, as prescribed by your healthcare practitioner.
tgt_text: zwiṅwe hafhu, muhasho wo eletshedza vhathu vha re na malwadze a sa fholiho uri: vha nwe mishonga nga nḓila yone, sa zwe vha randelwa nga dokotela wavho.

src_text: wash your hands with soap and water for at least 20 seconds, before you touch any medication.
tgt_text: vha ṱambe zwanḓa nga tshisibe na maḓi lwa mithethe i swikaho 20, phanḓa ha musi vha tshi fara mishonga miṅwe na miṅwe.

src_text: do not stop taking medication unless a healthcare practitioner tells you to and never share medication with anyone.
tgt_text: vha songo litsha u nwa kana u shumisa mishonga nga nnḓa ha musi dokotela a tshi vha vhudza uri vha litshe nahone vha songo vhuya vha kovhelana mishonga na muṅwe muthu.

src_text: try to do physical exercise for 30 minutes a day.
tgt_text: vha lingedze u ita nyonyoloso lwa minithe dza 30 nga ḓuvha.

src_text: the department says that people with diabetes face a higher chance of experiencing serious complications from covid19, but the risk of getting very sick is lower if one’s diabetes is well managed.
tgt_text: muhasho uri vhathu vha re na swigiri vha livhana na tshikhala tshihulwane tsha u tzhenzhema tsumbadwadze dzo kalulaho dzi re khombo u bva kha covid19, fhedzi khonadzeo ya khombo ya u lwalesa i vha fhasi arali vhulwadze ha swigiri havho vhu tshi khou langiwa zwavhuḓi.

src_text: "in general, people with diabetes are more likely to experience severe symptoms and complications when infected with a virus.
tgt_text: "nga u angaredza, vhathu vha re na swigiri vha na khonadzeo khulwane ya u tshenzhema tsumbadwadze dzi re khombo na hulela ha vhulwadze musi vho kavhiwa nga tshitzhili.

src_text: as diabetic individuals are at increased risk of severe covid19, ongoing social or physical distancing is recommended where possible.
tgt_text: sa izwi vhathu vha re na swigiri vha na khonadzeo khulwane ya u vha na tsumbadwadze dzi re khombo dza covid19, u dzulela u vha kule na muṅwe muthu zwo themendelwa hune zwa konadzea.

src_text: being overweight is also a risk factor for severe covid19.
tgt_text: u vha na muvhili muhulu na zwone ndi tshivhangi tsha khonadzeo ya u vha na covid19 i re khombo.

src_text: weight loss, if possible, is therefore recommended.
tgt_text: nga u ralo, u fhungudza muvhili, arali zwi tshi konadzea zwi a themendelwa.

src_text: "clean bill of healthafter being in isolation for 14 days, mohammed returned to work.
tgt_text: "u fhola tshoṱhe nga murahu ha u ḓivalela thungo lwa maḓuvha a 14, vho mohammed vho ḓo humela mushumoni.

src_text: she says recovering from the virus changed her thought processes and perspective on life.
tgt_text: vha ri u fhola kha tshitzhili tsha corona zwo shandukisa kuhumbulele na kuvhonele kwavho kwa vhutshilo.

src_text: "you appreciate your family and the small things in life even more.
tgt_text: vha ri "zwi ita uri u ṱanganedze vha muṱa wau na zwithu zwiṱuku vhutshiloni nga maanḓa.

src_text: i want people in any working environment to take responsibility for their health and to educate their families and children, especially now that kids are back at school.
tgt_text: ndi ṱoḓa vhathu vha tshi dzhia vhuḓifhinduleli ha mutakalo wavho mishumoni na u funza vha muṱa wavho na vhana, nga maanḓa zwino vhana vha tshi khou vhuyelela zwikoloni.

src_text: "help your child find creative ways to show affection to their friends, without going close and touching each other.
tgt_text: kha vha thuse ṅwana wavho nḓila dza vhuṱali dza u sumbedza khonani dzawe lufuno, hu si na u sendela tsini na u farana.

src_text: get your family to sterilise themselves before entering the home, leave your shoes in the garage if you can, take all your clothes off and shower before greeting your family and be more health conscious to protect them," she says.
tgt_text: kha vha ite uri vha muṱa wavho vha shumise zwivhulahatshitzhili phanḓa ha musi vha tshi dzhena nḓuni, u sia zwienda nnḓa garatshini arali vha tshi kona, vha bvule zwiambaro zwoṱhe vha ṱambe phanḓa ha musi vha tshi lumelisa vha muṱa wavho na u ṱhogomela vhukuma kha sia ḽa mutakalo u itela u vha tsireledza.

src_text: the department advises people with comorbidities to eat healthily, get regular exercise, manage their stress, adhere to their medical treatment plan and follow all necessary preventative measures.
tgt_text: "muhasho u eletshedza vhathu vha re na malwadze a sa fholiho u ḽa zwiḽiwa zwa mutakalo, u ita nyonyoloso tshifhinga tshoṱhe, u langa mutsiko wavho, u tevhedza pulane ya mishonga ya dzilafho na u tevhedza maga oṱhe a thivhelo o teaho.

src_text: insaaf mohammed who suffers from asthma, has beaten covid19.
tgt_text: vnga mashudu vha sa kavhiwe nga tshitzhili – vha ṱhogomela vhana vhashu vhaṅwe vhavhili," vho mohammed vha ralo.

src_text: if you are showing any symptoms, such as a fever, cough, or shortness of breath, contact the covid19 hotline on 0800 029 999 or whatsapp the word ‘hi’ to 0600 123 456.
tgt_text: mme vha na malwadze a sa fholi vho kunda covid19 silusapho nyanda vho insaaf mohammed vhari ndi zwa ndeme vhukuma uri maafrika tshipembe nga mannḓa avho vha na malwadze a sa fholiho uri vha dzhie vhuḓifhinduleli ha mutakalo wavho.

src_text: a special tribute to our healthcare vukuzenzele unnamed the number of deaths from coronavirus recently passed the 2000 mark.
tgt_text: ndivhuwo dzo khetheaho kha vhashumi vha ndondolamutakalo vhashu vukuzenzele unnamed tshivhalo tsha dzimpfu dza tshitzhili tsha corona zwa zwino tsho paḓa 2000. kha vho lovhaho hu na vhashumi vha ndondolamutakalo, vho ramaṱalimakone vhe vha ṱhogomela vha lwalaho, nahone vhe vha vha thikhedzo na mukhuthadzi kha avho vha re sibadela vho khethelwaho thungo kha miṱa yavho.

src_text: among those who have lost their lives are healthcare workers, consummate professionals who cared for the ill, and were a support and comfort to those in hospital isolated from their families.
tgt_text: zwauri vhanna na vhafumakadzi vho hwalaho mushumo wo khetheaho na u ṱhonifheaho na vhone vha khou kavhiwa nga vhulwadze vha lovha ndi zwithu zwi vhaisaho vhukuma.
